It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that appear to shimmer in the wind. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked due to their subtle appearance. Despite its rarity, Manochlaenia remains a symbol of the fragile beauty found in remote ecosystems.
